question:
You recently ordered a small item online but when it arrived it was unusable.
Write a letter to the company that sold you the item:
give details about the order you made
explain what was wrong with the item
tell the company what you want them to do about it
text: I am writing this letter to inform you about a delivery service that I received from your firm recently.

Two days before, I purchased an order of Hair Removal cream from your company website.Since I was premium member I got delivered the dispatch within two days of my order. Unfortunately, the item I ordered was broken in its case and its flushed the entire carton. I couldn't use the product since it was poorly packed. I got twenty spatulas and one cleaning oil with the package which was also spoiled because of the cream that spilled on it. I was totally disappointed by seeing that. I cannot believe your company with these many years of reputation is actually not caring about your customer's and their products.

Since I cannot use it at any cost I am going to return my product. I am not looking for an exchange in return. All I want is the return of my money into my account at the earliest. I am sorry to say that I totally lost my trust with your agency. I would suggest you to take an extra care in your company's packaging section. Because we, the customers are trusting you blindly when we order something from your site. Please don't break that contract.

error_list.error_des: The noun phrase premium member seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
The spelling of spilled is a non-British variant. For consistency, consider replacing it with the British English spelling.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
The verb take appears to be in the subjunctive mood. Consider removing the particle to.
The indefinite article, an, may be redundant when used with the uncountable noun care in your sentence. Consider removing it.
